TEXT.TEXTVALUE: notext
Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
A piece of glass wool is placed inside a funnel which is held in a funnel holder.
The centrifuge tube containing ascite is taken from the ice tray.
Open the tube.
The ascite is poured over the glass wool into the funnel, the liquid is being collected in the beaker placed under the funnel.
A pipette pump is taken.
And is connected to the pipette pump.
The bottle labeled as ‘PBS’ is opened.
4 ml of PBS solution is pipetted out from the bottle.
The pipetted out solution is now poured into the glass wool inside the funnel.
A glass rod is taken from the beaker.
The glass wool is squeezed with the glass rod to obtain all the samples.
15ml centrifuge tube is taken from the stand.
Open the tube.
Take the ascite collected in the beaker.
Now transferred to the centrifuge tube and is closed.
The centrifuge is opened.
The tube containing ascite is placed in the rotor.
Equal volume of water is taken in another tube and is placed exactly opposite to the already placed tube.
The lid of the centrifuge is closed.
Centrifuge at 13000 G for 30 minutes at 4˚C.
After 30minutes, open the centrifuge.
The tube containing ascite is taken out.
Open the cap of tube.
A Pasteur pipette is taken.
The supernatant is pipetted out using the Pasteur pipette without disturbing the pellet.
The supernatant is transferred to a beaker and the Pasteur pipette is kept back.
A stir bar is taken using forceps and is placed inside the beaker containing the supernatant.
A pipette pump is taken.
And is connected to the pipette pump.
The bottle labeled as ‘Saturated ammonium sulfate’ is opened.
4 ml of ammonium sulfate solution is pipetted out from the bottle.
The pipetted out solution is now slowly poured into the beaker.
Take the beaker containing the supernatant and the ammonium sulfate solution.
Placed on magnetic stirrer inside visi cooler.
The beaker containing the supernatant and the ammonium sulfate solution is placed on magnetic stirrer, and on switch on the stirrer.
All the proteins are allowed to precipitate for for2 hours at 4°C.
After 2 hours, the power supply is switched off and the beaker is taken out of the visi cooler.
The stir bar is removed from the solution.
50ml centrifuge tube is taken from the stand.
Open the tube.
Take the liquid inside the beaker.
The liquid inside the beaker is transferred to the centrifuge tube and is closed.
The centrifuge is opened.
The centrifuge is opened.
The tube containing the liquid is placed in the rotor.
Equal volume of water is taken in another tube and is placed exactly opposite to the already placed tube.
The lid of the centrifuge is closed.
Centrifuge at 13000 G for 1 hour at 4˚C.
After 1 hour, open the centrifuge.
The tube containing the suspension is taken out.
The tube is opened.
The supernatant is removed into a beaker while the pellet retains in the centrifuge tube.
Close the tube.
The tube with the pellet is kept in ice tray.
A pipette is taken and is connected to the pipette pump.
The bottle labeled as ‘PBS’ is opened.
10 ml of PBS is pipetted out from the bottle.
The centrifuge tube pellete is taken from the ice tray.
The tube is opened.
The pipetted out solution is poured into the tube containing pellet, Resuspend the pellet in PBS.
The tube containg the suspension is kept in ice tray.
Dialysis
A piece of dialysis tubing is taken from the ethanol storage solution using forceps.
The tubing is rinsed with distilled water into a wash beaker.
Dialysis clamp is taken.
Tube is clamped at one end of the tubing, leaving approximately 1cm extending from the clamp.
The tubing with the clamp at one end is kept on the work bench.
A pipette is taken and is connected to a pipette pump.
The tube containing the suspension is taken from the ice tray.
The tube containing the suspension is taken from the ice tray.
5ml of the suspension is pipetted out from the tube.
The tube is closed.
And kept back in ice tray.
The tubing is taken from the table.
Filled with the suspension taken in pipette.
The excess air is removed by squeezing the tubing gently with the fingers.
Take the another tube.
The tube is then clamped at the top.
The dialysis membrane is immersed in a beaker containing PBS buffer.
A stir bar is taken using forceps and is placed inside the beaker.
The beaker is taken to visi cooler.
Placed on magnetic stirrer inside visi cooler.
The beaker containing the suspension is placed on magnetic stirrer, and switch on the stirrer.
All the proteins are allowed to precipitate for for 4 hours at 4°C.
After 4 hours, the power supply is switched off and the beaker is taken out of the visi cooler.
Keep the beaker on the table.
The dialysis tubing is taken out of the buffer solution.
The dialysis tubing is placed on an absorbent paper and is wiped with another one.
The tubing is hold vertically and the upper clamp is released.
The suspension inside the tubing is pipetted out using a Pasteur pipette.
Take the 15 ml centrifuge tube.
Open the tube.
Transferred the suspension in to a 15 ml centrifuge tube.
Open the refrigerator.
The tube containing the suspension is kept inside a refrigerator.
Store the suspension in the tube for long period in the refrigerator.
